title: To the Last Man
description: "They fought to the last man in a desperate blood-feud that stained the sands of the Tonto basin"--Jacket.

title: Shalako
description: He rode wild country with wilder men. He was a loner who owned nothing but his horse and saddle-and his guns. He was a man willing to gamble his life to get the woman he wanted... He was Shalako.

title: Bendigo Shafter
description: Eighteen-year-old Bendigo Shafter arrives in a small Western settlement with a group of pioneers to begin a new life filled with struggle, adventure, and excitement.

title: Yondering
description: The popular Western author tells stories about sea adventures, episodes from World War II, and his acquaintances as a young man.

title: Wanderer of the wasteland
description: N/A

title: The Gunfighters
description: N/A

title: Fury of the Mountain Man
description: Like Jensen, the two Mexican gunfighters known as Carbone and Martine had put away their six-guns, married and turned to ranching down in Durango. Then they came up against an army of outlaws under a warlord who called himself Carvajal. That was when they called on Smoke Jensen.

title: The Burning Hills
description: The Louis L'Amour collection.

title: Dead Man's Range
description: Hugh was driving cattle to the Colorado Territory to the beef-starved gold miners ... but the owner of Fortier Valley, the only way through, refuses to let the herd cross her land.

title: The Warrior's Path
description: 1983 edition : The Louis L'Amour Collection.

title: Rick Steves Europe Through the Back Door
description: You can count on Rick Steves to tell you what you really need to know when traveling through Europe. With Rick Steves Europe Through the Back Door, you'll learn how to: -Plan your itinerary and maximize your time -Pack light and right -Find good-value hotels and restaurants -Travel smoothly by train, bus, car, and plane -Avoid crowds and tourist scams -Hurdle the language barrier -Understand cultural differences and connect with locals -Save money while enjoying the trip of a lifetimeAfter 30+ years of exploring Europe, Rick considers this travel skills handbook his life's work, and with his expert introductions to the top destinations in Europe, choosing your next trip will be easy and stress-free. Using the travel skills in this book, you'll experience the culture like a local, spend less money, and have more fun.

title: The Fire Arrow
description: Traveling with his Crow wife, Victoria, to her home, Barnaby Skye is pressed into service by a group of outlaws who intend to trade poisonous whiskey to Victoria's people. While he works with them, he plots to ruin their plans.

title: Lost Wolf
description: A Silver Star western.

title: The Virginian
description: N/A

title: Lucky Larribee
description: When Sky Blue, a magnificent and valuable but untamed horse, escapes captivity, Larribee, the only man ever to ride Sky Blue, must track her down before other fortune hunters find her.

title: The Peace Keeper
description: The Townspeople of Moriah had come to Luke Brazil for help. A group of wild cow hands were tearing the town apart. Would he accept the job of marshal? Luke thought he had put his past behind him. A former lawman and bounty hunter, Luke now owned a ranch and wanted only to settle down with Jenny Lockwood. But when they told him Jenny was trapped in the local hotel, he knew what his decision had to be. So he strapped on his Colt .45 and pinned on the marshal's star. One man alone, he went out to put an end to the violence.

title: The Golden Chance
description: The author of many action-packed Westerns, including The Stalking Moonand The Burning Sky, presents an adventure full of greed, glory, and grand Western style. Half-breed Gage Cameron is in a whole lot of trouble when he comes across a gold claim that pits him against a ruthless, racist rancher.

title: The Vengeance Trail of Josey Wales
description: Josey Wales is an outlaw who rides through vast sunbaked lands in search of a place where he can find peace. Jesus Escobedo is powerful and cruel. When he crosses paths with Josey Wales, he meets a force that is more powerful than good or evil--the pure vengeance that burns in Josey's heart.

title: Conagher
description: As far as the eye could see was a vast, empty horizon. Evie Teale had finally accepted that her husband wouldn't be coming home. Now she and the children were alone in an untamed country where the elements, Indians, and thieves made it far easier to die than to live. Miles away, another solitary soul battled for survival. Conagher was a lean, dark-eyed drifter who wasn't about to let a gang of rustlers push him around. While searching the isolated canyons for missing cattle, he found notes tied to tumbleweeds rolling with the wind. The bleak, spare words echoed Conagher's own whispered prayers for companionship. Who was this mysterious woman on the other side of the wind? For Conagher, staying alive long enough to find her wasn't going to be easy.

title: Day of the Hunter
description: N/A

title: Blood on the Trail
description: N/A

title: Flint
description: He left the West at the age of seventeen, leaving behind a rootless past and a bloody trail of violence. In the East he became one of the wealthiest financiers in America-and one of the most feared and hated.Now, suffering from incurable cancer, he has come back to New Mexico to die alone. But when an all-out range war erupts, Flint chooses to help Nancy Kerrigan, a local rancher. A cold-eyed speculator is setting up the land swindle of a lifetime, and Buckdun, a notorious assassin, is there to back his play.Flint alone can help Nancy save her ranch...with his cash, his connections-and his gun. He still has his legendary will to fight. All he needs is time, and that's fast running out....

title: McKettrick's Choice
description: The "New York Times" bestselling author of more than 75 books continues her McKettrick Cowboys series with this new tale of romance on the Western front.

title: No One Can Hide
description: Tending to a wounded stranger, Cathy has no idea what danger it will bring to her peaceful life. The man belongs to a gang of ruthless bank robbers who attempted to raid the National Bank in the small town of Bethlehem. Unfortunately for them, Reuben Cole and Sterling Roose are also in town, and now the survivors are on the run. But to bring the stragglers back, Cole will need to look deep into his soul and answer some serious questions about himself. When good friends die, what will be more important: revenge or justice? This is the large print edition of No One Can Hide, with a larger font / typeface for easier reading.﻿

title: The Last Trail
description: Jonathan Zane seeks revenge against the man who abducted his sweetheart and controls a gang of marauding outlaws and Indians.

title: The Cold Dish
description: The first book in the New York Times bestselling Longmire series, featuring Sheriff Walt Longmire After twenty-five years as Sheriff of Absaroka County, Walt Longmire's hopes of ending his tenure in peace are dashed when Cody Pritchard is found dead near the Northern Cheyenne Reservation. Two years earlier, Cody was one of four high school boys given suspended sentences for raping a local Cheyenne girl. Somebody, it would seem, is seeking vengeance, and Longmire might be the only thing standing between the three remaining boys and a Sharps .45-70 rifle. With lifelong friend Henry Standing Bear and Deputy Victoria 'Vic' Moretti, Walt Longmire attempts to see that revenge, a dish best served cold, is never served at all.

title: The Tar-Aiym Krang
description: A pickpocket living on the beautiful winged planet of Moth, Flinx, a young orphan and his mini-dragon Pip become trapped in a web of conspiracy and murder when Flinx steals a starmap from a corpse, in a new edition of the classic science fiction novel. Reissue.

title: Captain's Rangers
description: N/A

title: Kilkenny
description: Kilkenny seems to attract thieves, violence, and death.

title: The Rainbow Trail
description: "A thrilling sequel to Riders of the Purple Sage"--Jacket.

title: The Return of the Rancher
description: The wounded outlaw blurted out the warning to range boss Jim Seton, and Seton knew that if he wasn't careful, the man's words would prove true; Doug Walters' men were out for his blood. After five years in prison, Seton dared to return to the hostile town he called home and within shooting range of the one man who would pay a fortune to see him dead.

title: The Mysterious Rider
description: The story of a terrible gunfighter with a strange history and of Columbine Belllounds, a lost child brought up by a stern old rancher who expects her out of gratitude to marry his rascally son.

title: Riders West
description: Neel St. Cloud, fired up by his feud with Dan Bellew, had plans to turn Bellew's peaceful valley into an outlaw strip ruled by guns and fear. -- First he put his bought-and-paid-for sheriff into office. Then he imported an army of professional gunslicks, took over Trail City, and burned out the nesters, one by one. With the remaining spreads isolated, St. Cloud was ready to make his big move. And one cold, storm-lashed night, a hundred flaming guns fought it out, with Dan Bellew in the middle, fighting for the valley's life-and his own.

title: Sitka
description: Battle-hardened Jean LaBarge came of age on the American frontier, and is always in search of bold adventure. He'll find more than he bargains for in the rugged Alaskan territory, where he'll meet his match in Baron Zinnovy. Now he must defeat this savage, empire-hungry Russian to save his country's right to claim this frozen landscape ... and to win over the heart of the beautiful princess he loves!

title: Buffalo Wagons
description: For Gage Jameson, the summer of 1873 has been a poor hunt. A year ago he felled sixty-two buffalo in one stand, but now the great Arkansas River herd is gone, like the Republican herd before it. In Dodge City, old hide hunters speak is awe of a last great heard to the south--but no hunter who values his scalp dares ride south of the Cimarron and into Comanche territory. None but Gage Jameson....

title: Under the Tonto Rim
description: No description given.

title: Gold Wagon
description: N/A

title: Reilly's Luck
description: Eight-year-old Val learns about the frontier from Reilly.

title: The Proving Trail
description: Kearney McRaven attempts to solve the mysterious death of his father and claim his right to a big fortune which includes thousands of dollars and the deed to a ranch.

title: Sackett's Land
description: During the early seventeenth century, Barnabas Sackett is declared an outlaw in his native England and flees his homeland to seek adventure and fortune in the new land of America.t--Novelist.

title: Leaving Cheyenne
description: The story of a love triangle that spanned a generation, of a friendship that endured from dusty wagons to private planes, and a rancher's legacy.

title: The Light of Western Stars
description: Eastern girl settles down as westerner, buys and restocks the largest ranch in the country.

title: Thieves' Trail
description: Four strangers came down the Raton Pass into New Mexico where they were promptly arrested by armed cowmen and jailed in the town of Stockdale. Two days later, the four were released when a dead man was labeled the real horse thief. The story would have ended then and there, except that one of the men recognized the dead horse thief as his brother.

title: Appaloosa
description: When Virgil Cole and Everett Hitch arrive in Appaloosa, they find a small, dusty town suffering at the hands of renegade rancher Randall Bragg, a man who has so little regard for the law that he has taken supplies, horses, and women for his own and left the city marshal and one of his deputies for dead. Cole and Hitch, itinerant lawmen, are used to cleaning up after opportunistic thieves, but in Bragg they find an unusually wily adversary-one who raises the stakes by playing not with the rules, but with emotions.

title: The Sky-liners
description: The adventures of members of the Sackett family in the frontier West.

title: Silver Canyon
description: Gunfighter Matt Brennan rides into a range war and meets the woman of his dreams.

title: Die of Gold
description: N/A

title: Sundance
description: The land echoed with the thundering hoofs of Medoc ponies. In minutes they swooped down and captured the wagon train and its cargo of gold. But now the halfbreed they called Sundance was going after it, and he swore nothing would stand in his way--not Indian savagery or the vicious gunfighters of the town named Hell.

title: Kilrone
description: Medicine Dog had sworn to take his scalp. Iron Dave Sproul was gunning for revenge. All the Bannocks and Paiutes wanted him dead, too. But Major Frank Paddock trusted Barney Kilrone and gave him command of a fort. Betty Considine gave him her love, and that promised a future for him, as long as he kept his courage and the fastest gun in the West.

title: Wolf River
description: New York City author Erinn Winters is haunted by a hidden past and visions of death and danger that come to her without warning. When a desperate search for her estranged sister leads her to Montana, Erinn suddenly finds her secrets, even her very life, at risk. And after meeting sexy Jase Fortune, Erinn finds herself in another kind of danger - losing her heart.

title: The Quick and the Dead
description: Con Vallian encounters Duncan McKaskel and his family heading west and saves Duncan from outlaws. He soon finds himself guiding Duncan, Duncan?s beautiful wife, Susanna, and their son, Tom, across the prairie, and fighting off rustlers, Huron Indians, and a lion along the way.

title: Boone's Lick
description: "Boone's Lick" is a major novel in the rich tradition of "Lonesome Dove" and "Comanche Moon" about the opening up of the American West. The first novel in a new series, it is the story of a trek by riverboat and wagon from Boone's Lick, Missouri, to Fort Phil Kearny in Wyoming, and proves to be one of McMurtry's richest and most satisfying works.

title: The Drifter
description: A powerful new series from the author of the acclaimed series, "The Mountain Man." This new saga weaves together tales of warriors and outlaws, lawmen and adventurers, starting with Frank Logan, driven out of Colorado by a grudge. The drifter takes up gun fighting in the New Mexico Territory and confronts a vicious outlaw gang.

title: Bowdrie
description: The Texas Rangers recruit a hardened gunman, Bowdrie, because they didn't want to fight against him.

title: The Gallows Land
description: "A man didn't ask too many questions in the Arizona badlands if he wanted to stay alive." --

title: Introduction to Early Medieval Western Europe, 300-900
description: This comprehensive survey synthesises a quarter of a century of pathbreaking research in an accessible manner for undergraduate students. Matthew Innes combines an account of the historical background of the period with discussion of the social, economic, cultural and political structures within it.

title: Gunsong at Twilight
description: N/A

title: Black Aces
description: In an attempt to redeem himself to his neighbors and his sweetheart, Tedro Ames is determined to unmask the "Black Ace" Gang, ruthless blackmailers who are terrorizing the town of Swiftwater.

title: To Tame a Land
description: Rye Tyler was twelve when his father was killed in an Indian raid. Taken in by a mysterious stranger with a taste for books and an instinct for survival, Rye is schooled in the hard lessons of life in the West. But after killing a man, he is forced to leave his new home. He rides lonely mountain passes and works on dusty cattle drives until he finds a job breaking horses. Then he meets Liza Hetrick, and in her eyes he sees his future. After establishing himself as marshal of Alta, he returns, only to discover that Liza has been kidnapped. Tracking her to Robbers' Roost, Rye is forced to face the man who taught him all he knows about books, guns, and friendship. Two old friends--one woman: Who will walk away?

title: Outlaw
description: The American Old West stands for many things, and one of them is outlaw Lee Garland! Since the first Apache uprising made him an orphan, he's seen it all and done it all. Whether during war or peace, he's killed a few men, loved a lot of women, and made and lost millions. Here's the saga of one of the last great heroes of the Old West.

title: Judas Pass
description: Death stalks Shaeriff Chad Cooper, and it seemed that no sooner had he consigned one badman to Boot Hill than another was gunning for him

title: Man of the Shadows
description: When he is separated from his tribe in a hunt, losing his horse and breaking his leg, Eagle, a young warrior of The People, is rescued by an old man living alone in the woods, who Eagle begins to suspect is the incarnation of a supernatural figure from his tribe's legends.

title: Born to Trouble
description: Ranger Jim Trammel is up against Arizona's most lawless lowlifes.

title: Man in the saddle (Motion picture)
description: N/A

title: Hannah and the Horseman at the Gallows Tree
description: Hannah and Pete find themselves in more trouble.

title: Showdown at Yellow Butte
description: Battle-hardened Tom Kedrick is hired by Alton Burwick to drive a pack of renegades and outlaws from his land, but soon Kendrick suspects that he is fighting for the wrong man and that he is the only one who can stop a massacre of innocent men and women.

title: Table Rock
description: This classic novel by the celebrated author is fully restored to Savage's original intentions. Teenager Gordon Conners finds himself on the run from vicious trackers who think he has information about a robbery committed by his father years ago.

title: Hot Iron
description: In the early days of the Texas panhandle, Espy Norwood is a troubleshooter who's got troubles of his own. Bitter landowners plot against him, determined cattle thieves sneak right under his nose, and his own son refuses to trust or even know him. Can he catch the thieves, save the ranch, and win his son's love? Reissue.

title: Treasure Mountain
description: Orrin Sackett and his brothers find themselves in danger when they search for gold on a trail made by their missing father twenty years earlier.

title: Utah!
description: Brawny work gangs and rugged engineers blast out tunnels and lay countless miles of rails to link a vast continent from coast to coast. Indians and unscruplous ranchers try to stop them while Toby Holt tries to keep order in the land.

title: The Heritage of the Desert
description: Easterner John Hare comes West to improve his health, but is mistaken for a cattleman's spy by outlaws and becomes a hunted man.

title: The Trouble at Pena︢ Blanca
description: N/A

title: The Tall Stranger
description: Scouting for a wagon train full of high hopes, Rock saved the Eastern-bred settlers from a brutal Indian attack.

title: Riders of the Purple Sage
description: The story of Lassiter, a gunslinging avenger in black, who shows up in a remote Utah town just in time to save the young and beautiful rancher Jane Withersteen from having to marry a Mormon elder against her will. Lassiter is on his own quest, one that ends when he discovers a secret grave on Jane's grounds.

title: Slumber Mountain
description: A collection of three of the author's best novellas, restored to their original versions from his owntypescripts, includes "The Outlaw Crew," "The Coward," and "Slumber Mountain," in which a trapper fights for his life against a wolf pack. Original.

title: Gunsights
description: Lieutenant Early, a cavalry officer, and Dana Moon, a guide, lead the pursuit to Loco, the leader of a group of renegade Apaches, who have kidnapped Katherine McKean

title: Rivers West
description: Two hardy young men brave the dangers of the frontier and the hazards thrown in their way by the Baron Richard Torville who is scheming to take over the Louisiana Territory.

title: The Wolf Strain
description: Ben Flinder's life at an isolated hotel in the mountains is complicated by the arrival of a young woman who is on the run. Befriended by the Gray Shadow, even he is unable to prevent her capture by her pursuers.

title: Gunblaze
description: N/A

title: Cheyenne Gold
description: N/A

title: The High Graders
description: Louis L'Amour hardcover collection.

title: Hard Justice
description: Color illustration on front cover of two vignettes: head portrait of bearded man wearing black western hat and black bandana; man on horseback firing a rifle at a Native American in a canyon.

title: Resolution
description: Relocating to an Old West saloon town, Everett Hitch takes a job protecting the women in a house of ill repute but finds his peace at the side of an old friend challenged by a hired gun and a greedy mine owner.

title: Llano River
description: In "Llano River," Dundee works to stop a cattle rustling operation and gets caught in the middle of a deadly feud.

title: Bodie
description: Bodie was a bounty-hunter, a legalised killer. He was a survivor in a tough world where a gunman's life depended on his ruthlessness and his speed on t he draw. For Bodie, killing was a trade and he was on hire to anyone with enough money and desperation. One man tried to take Bodie for a two-bit greenhorn -- but Bodie wasn't about to be taken ...

title: Lando
description: This series explores the settling of the American West by focusing on the exploits of several generations of the Sackett family.

title: Short Grass
description: N/A

title: Silver Stallion
description: N/A

title: The Killers
description: Gem Theater owner Al Swearengen and whorehouse madam Laurette Parkhurst want Wild Bill Hickok killed. They don't want Deadwood--and their dirty profits--cleaned up. But the famous gunman can only be killed if he deliberately lets his guard down, and Hickok would never be so careless. Original.

title: The Ballad of Cat Ballou
description: The Ballad of Cat Ballou is the story of Cat Ballou and bandit Clay Boone's love "in the face of treachery and danger."--Book jacket.

title: Lure of the Wild
description: N/A

title: Gunman, Gunman
description: High roller frank Endite an't keep his eyes off the bewitching, red-headed Taisy Aiken. Not that she means anything to him. No woman is going to change his way of thinking, and Frank has too much at stake to risk is for any woman, even one as beautiful as Taisy.

title: The Day of the Beast
description: Set in Middletown, USA, this tells the story of Daren Lane, who returns from World War I to a society of declining morals tired of hearing about the war.

title: The Stalking Moon
description: N/A

title: The Seven Men at Mimbres Springs
description: N/A

title: The Dakota Deal
description: Escaped prisoner John McCallum's discovery of a deserted cabin and a dead body provides an opportunity to assume a new identity, and different clothing. But McCallam doesn't know the nature of the man he's become. The people of North Bend mistake McCallum for the notorious gunman, Frank Chater, hired to rid the town of the growing menace of Royce Chisholm and his sadistic sidekicks. Has he exchanged one prison for another? Or can he escape both?

title: Buckskin Run
description: Collection of frontier short stories.

title: The Trail to Seven Pines
description: Previously published: Hipalong Cassidy and the Trail to Seven Pines. c1951.

title: Blue Feather and Other Stories
description: N/A

title: Angel Train
description: An unlikely romance kindles along the dangerous Oregon Trail between a devoutyoung woman and soon-to-be ex-convict, in this mid-1800s tale.

title: Stranger from Neutral Strip
description: N/A

title: The Range Finder
description: Three of the finest short novels by Brand, one of the world's most celebrated Western writers, are gathered for this collection. Includes the title story, "The Range Finder," along with "The Whisperer" and "Flaming Fortune."

title: The Sheriff's Son
description: N/A

title: The Holy Road
description: Treacherous white men close in from every direction, and rumors of invasion cause anxiety.

title: Under the Sun
description: N/A

title: Six-gun Country
description: N/A

title: Men Beyond the Law
description: In Werewolf, Christopher Royal flees after a gunfight. In the vastness of the wilderness, through the medium of an ancient Cheyenne, he is confronted with terrors far greater than the gunfighter who is pursuing him. In The Finding of Jeremy, a young New Yorker forsakes his profession to go West and finds riches beyond his wildest dreams. And The Trail Up Old Arrowhead concludes the story of gentle giant Bull Hunter, all classic tales by the master of the genre.

title: Utah Blaine
description: Utah Blaine--he was a big man and fast with a gun. Very fast. There were plenty of stories about Utah Blaine and his gun.

title: Deadman Canyon
description: N/A

title: The Rancher's Revenge
description: A John Saxon was planning to marry Mary Wilson, the prettiest girl in town. But Bob Witherell had other ideas - he was going to have Mary for himself, so he burned Saxon's house and barn to the ground, stole his cattle, and humiliated him.

title: Blood Red River
description: The buffalo brought them west: frontiersmen like Billy Dixon, who made his living with a long-barreled rifle, and businessmen like George Eddy, who balanced the books for a frontier trading company.

title: Ramrod Rider
description: Bank robber Wes Trevannon is desperately chasing his lost self-respect while determined lawman Jans Vandermeer is chasing him. In the end, Jans will learn a powerful lesson from Wes: that justice and the law aren't always on the same side.

title: The Manhunter
description: A frontier bounty hunter comes to regret his reliance on violence as the way to deliver justice.

title: Mission to the West
description: Based on the first assignment of the 1st Regiment of United States Dragoons, the "Horse Soldiers" - forerunner of the U.S. Cavalry.

title: Range Trouble
description: The young Ballinger family arrived out west to homestead a small ranch. Trouble begins soon after when their only two horses are stolen off their land.

title: The Mountain Valley War
description: The Louis L'Amour collection.

title: Guns of the Timberlands
description: Clay Bell is determined to fight to the death against Jud Devitt, who wants to take away his timberland.

title: An Outlaw's Christmas
description: Heading to Blue River, Texas, to seek a job as a marshal, Sawyer McKettrick instead finds himself at the mercy of calico-clad teacher Piper St. James, who may be the only one who can tame his wild heart.

title: The Sacking of El Dorado
description: N/A

title: Ghost Valley
description: For Frank Morgan, the mystery of what happened to a ghost town in the Rocky Mountain Valley must take second fiddle to freeing his son. (from back cover).

title: Blood Game
description: N/A

title: The Overlords
description: As World War I is fought in Europe, the Wild West lives in Galveston, owned by a handful of criminal kingpins of gambling, liquor, and show business. They don't count on a stubborn Hollywood stuntman who has inherited his uncle's bank. Nor can they predict that a Texas Ranger and a beautiful undercover agent will try to shut down America's paradise of gambling. Original.

title: Stone Song
description: "The only significant work of fiction on the Lakota Sioux since Ruth Beebe Hill's "Hanto Yo.""--"Library Journal." Reissue.

title: Billy the Kid
description: Traces the chain of events that shaped the man who became Billy the Kid and pitted him against a treacherous and violent society that threatened those he cared for. Reprint.

title: Call of the Gun
description: In this action-packed story filled with unforgettable characters, a custom-made Colt Peacemaker wreaks havoc on the life of each man who owns it.

title: The Fugitive's Mission
description: Collects three short novels that capture the spirit and adventure of the Old West, including a story in which a man gets more than he bargained for when he discovers a coded message that reveals the location of a buried treasure.

title: Gunsmoke in Paradise
description: N/A

title: The Iron Marshall
description: N/A

title: Joe Pepper
description: An aging gunfighter reminisces about his life of adventure throughout the Old Southwest while preparing to face the hangman's noose

title: Jubal Sackett
description: Restless explorer Jubal Sackett journeys westward into the vast, unmapped wilderness of seventeenth-century America and discovers the perils of the rugged frontier, a new way of life among the Indians, and the love of a beautiful Natchez Indian princess

title: New Hope
description: An anthology of westerns, written in the first half of the century. In The Roaring Hour, a marshall faces a crooked sheriff, The Hour of Fury is on a gold-mining camp, and in The Kid from River Red a young man holds up a stagecoach to prove his manhood. By the author of the story, Stage to Lordsburg, which was made into the film, "Stagecoach."

title: Grub Line Rider
description: Collected in paperback for the first time are seven of L'Amour's finest stories of the Old West, all carefully restored to their original magazine publication versions. Includes Black Rock Coffin Makers and Desert Death Song.

title: Wild Horse Shorty
description: People should know better than to cross Shorty, the toughest, most stubborn horseman west of the Mississippi.

title: Fire Dance at Spider Rock
description: Rim Fannin signs on as a mule skinner on a wagon train to prove that the owner of White Mountain Freight is the traitor responsible for his father's death. When the train is attacked by Indians, Rim is captured and brought to Canyon de Chelly, where he discovers why he has been taken alive.

title: El Dorado
description: Western. Searching for his lost wife in blinding mountain storms, Solomon King is joined by a party of gold carrying miners, one of a whom is prepared to kill everyone to keep the gold.

title: The Bells of San Carlos and Other Stories
description: Four stories - Cayenne Charlie, The Bells of San Carlos, Between one and Three, The Gift.

title: Fallon
description: Cowtown gambler Macon Fallon is doomed if he fails to remove the posse from his trail

title: The Maverick Queen
description: When Linc Bradway came to South Pass, Wyoming, to avenge the death of his partner, he found it a wide open mining town where life was cheap and gold was to be had for the digging. And in South Pass, which was full of gunslingers and gamblers, he found something he didn't reckon on: the beautiful, daring Kit Bandon, the 'Maverick Queen'. How did Kit link up with the unexplained death of Jimmy Weston?

title: The Showdown Trail
description: Rock Bannon, whose reputation as a gunfighter marks him an outcast among decent folk, must convince a group of naive homesteaders that a smooth-talking scoundrel is taking them down a dangerous path.

title: The Time It Never Rained
description: N/A

title: Yuma Brand
description: N/A

title: High Vermilion
description: N/A

title: Campaigning
description: Sean Callahan, Navaho John and his sister, Juana, and Hannibal, a former slave, join Kit Carson in his war against the Comanches

title: Killoe
description: Dan Killoe had a trail herd and settlers to get across unknown territory to a new land, but when he gave shelter to a stranger, he was borrowing more trouble than he wanted to handle.

title: Soldier in Buckskin
description: The life of Christopher "Kit" Carson, the 19th Century folk hero. The novel follows his exploits as a hunter and guide, his exploration of Oregon and California, and his service in the Mexican War and the Civil War from which he emerged a brigadier general. Also described is his marriage to an Indian princess, and after her death to an aristocratic Spanish beauty.

title: Horse Heaven Hill
description: A spirited girl of the Northwest and a cruel wild horse drive.

title: Wind Over Rimfire
description: N/A

title: By the Gun
description: A collection of six Western stories by an author who specializes in his presentations of lone men fighting powerful forces

title: The Tonto Woman and Other Western Stories
description: From a forbidden glance on a Miami night to a killer's slow burn on a Detroit street, no one mixes passion, scheming, and violence better than Elmore Leonard. But before he did it in Miami Beach or Motor City, Elmore Leonard did it on the American frontier. This raw, hard-bitten collection gathers together the best of Leonard's Western fiction. In stories that burn with passion, treachery, and heroism, the American frontier comes vividly, magnificently to life. In "Only Good Ones," we meet a fine man turned killer in one impossible moment . . . "Saint with a Six-Gun" pits a doomed prisoner against his young guard--in a drama of deception and compassion that leads to a shocking act of courage . . . and in "The Colonel's Lady," a brutal ambush puts a woman into the hands of a vicious renegade--while a tracker attempts a rescue that cannot come in time. Etching a harsh, haunting landscape with razor-sharp prose, Elmore Leonard shows in nineteen brilliant stories why he has become the American poet laureate of the desperate and the bold.

title: The Badge
description: N/A

title: Danger Rode Drag
description: Nevada Jim Gage had intelligence, split second timing, nerves of steel, expertise with a six gun to match any gunman and a reputation for putting many a tough hombre out of action. But this time Jims adversary wasn't so tough -- he was just cunning.

title: A Man for Temperance
description: Raised in the Oregon territory of the 1800s where her parents established a strict religious colony, she was never allowed to have a suitor but now longs for a family of her own.

title: The Best Western Stories of Ed Gorman
description: N/A

title: Escape from Five Shadows
description: Surrounded by hostile Indians and the inhospitable desert, Five Shadows labor camp nonetheless cannot hold the explosive Corey Bowen, a man who will stop at nothing to clear his name.

title: Robbery in Savage Pass
description: Soames Ho accepts work from a Pinkerton agent, to take gold from Marysville to a Californian bank. But the driver of the stagecoach carrying the gold is nervous; the shotgun rider a greenhorn. They travel through Savage Pass, only to face three men intent on robbery. But the Pinkerton agent's deliberate plan, to have an ineffectual escort for the stagecoach, underestimates Soames. He believes in justice, and whatever the cost, he's determined to find the gold and the outlaws.

title: Warrior Road
description: Part Indian Boone Terrell left the tribe after oil was discovered on tribal land. He had no intention of returning just to watch the white man usurp his tribes' newly found wealth. There was nothing left in his heart to draw him back ... except, he had a score to settle. Terrell's friend's death was no accident; he knew better. Adventure and danger ensue which turns the hunter into the hunted when Terrell is suspected of committing another murder and becomes the target for a third.

title: Wyoming Fierce
description: " Ranch owner Cane Kirk lost more than his arm in the war. He lost his way, battling his inner demons by challenging any cowboy unfortunate enough to get in his way. No one seems to be able to cool him down, except beautiful Bodie Mays. Bodie doesn't mind saving Cane from himself, even if he is a little too tempting for her own peace of mind. But soon Bodie's the one who finds herself in need of rescuing--only, she's afraid to tell Cane what's really going on. How can she trust someone as unpredictable as this fierce cowboy? When her silence only ends up getting her into even deeper hot water, it's up to Cane to save the day. And if he does it right, he won't be riding off into the sunset alone"--Publisher.

title: The Dude Ranger
description: Greenhorn Ernest Selby inherits a cattle ranch in Arizona. Someone has been rustling cattle there. So Selby gets himself an alias and signs on as a ranch hand to see what he can find out.

title: Devil's Backbone
description: Chasing a string of rumors, Donegan learns that a second uncle now farms in Oregon, where Seamus will become entangled with Captain Jack's Modoc War, 1872-73, the army's longest and most costly Indian campaign to date.

title: Westward the Tide
description: Matt Bardoul receives a mysterious warning not to go with the wagon train taking gold seekers to the Big Horns, but is determined to seek his fortune.

title: Comstock Lode
description: The world's greatest silver strike brings together a loner named Val and Grita, a beautiful actress.

title: The Welding Quirt
description: The title story of this trio involves Snoozer Mell, who returns home after years of gambling and hard living, only to find that it isn't so easy to leave the past behind.

title: Rope the Wind
description: N/A

title: The Guns of Folly
description: When he had been a mere youth, Dale Stone had joined a bunch of mustangers who were corraling and breaking the wild horses which roamed and ranges, only to find out too late that many of the horses were blotted brands. But he did learn the value of speed and breeding in a horse. And now he was returning with Midnight, a beautiful black, to test his stamina in a race to the death which would also decide dale's own fate....

title: The Bar-20 Three
description: "When Hopalong and Red hear that Johnny Nelson has been knocked over the head and robbed of a big chunk of cash over in Mesquite, they race to his aid--and are immediately framed for a bank robbery"--

title: Westward the Women
description: Stories by Willa Cather, Mary Austin, Mari Sandoz, and Leslie Silko, among other women writers, who have illuminated the Western experience.

title: The Spotted Horse
description: N/A

title: Stormy in the West
description: Now an agent for the Stock Growers Association, Mark Sabin returns to Arrowhead, his hometown, to help stop a cattleman's feud

title: Violence of the Mountain Man
description: When his wife and neighbor's daughter are kidnapped by outlaw Reece Van Arndt, mountain man Smoke Jensen will go to great and deadly lengths to find the women, catching Reece off guard. (Western).

title: In the Blood
description: Detective Simms of the Pinkerton Detective Agency receives orders for another mission. Desperadoes are taking advantage of the fledgling railroads that cut through the endless plains, and the Pinkertons are charged with protecting the valuable cargo. After a powerful group sets their eyes on the scarcely guarded carriages, Simms begins to shadow the train robbers. But soon, he realizes that someone is hunting him instead. One of them will end up six feet under... by the bullet.

title: Last of the Breed
description: When his experimental aircraft is forced down over the Bering Sea by Russians, U.S. Air Force Major Joseph "Joe Mack" Makatozi must seek his safety in the uncharted wilds of Siberia, pursued by Colonel Zamatev of the GRU and by a Yakut tracker

title: Bad Night at Dry Creek
description: The Murphy gang wants to know where bank robber Willy Murphy hid his money before he diesand theyre not afraid to threaten the entire town of Dry Creek in order to get a straight answer.

title: Western Union
description: Wayne Cameron travels West to meet his destiny.

title: Wyoming
description: N/A

title: The Guns of Bitter Creek
description: N/A

title: Thunderbird Trail
description: Trapped in a ranch house, a gang of train robbers were holding off a posse. Quist was thinking any minute now, when a rifle barked and the sheriff called for an immediate attack. His last command was to close in, ignore the bullets, and pretend not to care whether death came or not.

title: By Duty Bound
description: The authentic tales of a rugged frontiersman struggling to live free.

title: Rangers' Revenge
description: Marshal Will Carston would unite his boys and wage war if it was the last thing he did. Nothing could stop him from avenging the brutal murder of his wife and the massacre of his ranch. Not the love of a brave pioneer woman, nor the wily games of a Yankee officer.

title: A Man Named Shonto
description: They were already hanging Marshal Holder when Shonto rode into town. It was one hell of a welcome for a loner with a gun but Shonto sensed that things were going to get even worse. He was right. The marshal's body was still swinging from the cottonwood across the street from his own jailhouse when the town became a bloody battleground. At that point, Shonto had just two choices: shoot to kill or join the lawman in hell.

title: War Party
description: A boy on the brink of manhood, a resourceful frontier woman who has beauty as well as fortitude, and a strong male character who is single and hence marriageable come together in this powerful, romantic, and strangely compelling vision of the American West.

title: Last Gun at Cabresto
description: N/A

title: A Time for Hanging
description: An Evans novel of the West.

title: Who Rides with Wyatt
description: They called Tombstone the Sodom of the Sagebrush until Wyatt Earp came to town and pinned on a badge. Before he left Tombstone, he had become a legend, the greatest gunfighter of all time.

title: Stormy in the West
description: Western. Mark Sabin, an agent for the Stock Grower's Association, is chosen to help stop a cattlemen's feud which is escalating out of control. To add to his problems a blizzard is about to descend.

title: Tomahawk Justice
description: The two young Shoshone women Skye Fargo finds in the wilderness seem too beautiful to be real. But they are real . . . real dangerous. When Fargo agrees to protect their father, he finds himself in the middle of a redskin bloodbath.

title: Track the Man Down
description: Big Torrey stands six-foot-five with the muscles of a bull. He has one rule--keep out of other people's business. But there are no rules when it comes to cold-blooded murder. That's why he swears to bring Manigault to justice. Trouble is, Manigault's family takes his prisoner into Morales, he knows he is heading for a showdown--one where the only rule is kill or be killed.

title: In the Hills of Monterey
description: When the beautiful Ortiza Tarabal's father sends to Spain for a suitable bridegroom, the chosen Spanish don is accompanied to California by an English slave who, ultimately, thwarts a governor's evil plan and wins the lady's heart.

title: Man Riding West
description: Eight stories deal with an old prospector, a drifter who encounters a gang of cattle rustlers, a coward who must prove himself, a young rancher who refuses to be driven from his new home, and a corrupt sheriff

title: Home Ranch
description: N/A

title: The Long Season
description: Any reader who enjoys the grit and glory of the Old West has a treat in store with this book. A working cowboy when he isn't writing, Sam Brown expertly brings to life the story of Jesse Coldiron, a cowboy willing to die--or kill--to defend his stake.

title: Flying Eagle
description: Former policeman Jay McGraw is a messenger for Wells Fargo. While sometimes, boring, it's steady work and Jay rarely misses walking a beat in Chinatown. But trouble comes his way when a gang of masked bandits blow up a bridge on the Central Pacific trail. Jay knows they re after his cargo. Wells Fargo could lose their heavily insured shipment and he could lose his cushy job. A dramatic escape via a hydrogen balloon belonging to a passenger puts Jay safely on the ground - in the middle of a deadly range war between cattlemen and Basque sheepherders...

title: A Marshal for Lawless
description: In need of money to purchase a ranch, John Glyde accepts the well-paying job of marshal in the New Mexico Territory town called Lawless and does not have to wait long to meet the reason for his high salary--the man who had orignally given the town its nam

title: Wyoming Tough
description: Ranch owner Mallory Kirk meets his match in his new cowgirl, a petite young woman who has a lot of spirit and will do anything to prove herself and keep his ranch running.

title: To Find a Dinosaur
description: Zack Keech was out to collect.

title: Dark Trail
description: Leo Guild is drawn into a dangerous confrontation between his old friend, gunfighter Josh Cain, now a pitiful alcoholic, and the ambitious young gunfighter whom Cain has agreed to fight for a cash prize that will go to the winner

title: SAVAGE RENDEZVOUS
description: N/A

title: Oliver's Kingdom
description: All his life Oliver King has been hard and mean. Only one man has ever defied him Jonty Kilbride. But Jonty is getting old and he wants to know his only living relative, his granddaughter, Janie. But she is not without a past and whe she meets Oliver they both come up against a force they can't control. Will gun or hangman's rope decide it all?

title: Go-Ahead Rider
description: Returning home to Oklahoma after the Civil War, a Harvard-educated, mixed-blood Cherokee takes a job as a deputy to Sheriff Go-Ahead Rider and finds himself pursuing a killer. Reprint.

title: Seven for Vengeance
description: Western. They rode together on the trail of a killer, each with a private hate in his holster - and his own brand of justice in mind.

title: Justice
description: In the town of Bannet, the young son of a powerful land baron is the leader of the notorious Half Moon Gang. Arizona Ranger Sam Burrack must go up against a corrupt system, a powerful man of money, and a band of deadly outlaws to see that everyone gets his fair share of justice. Reissue.
